-Cons:
"The One Free Bullet" achievement just cost you one keyboard

This is a very fun next episode to Half Life 2. Even though this episode is shorter than usual, it makes up for it with the atmosphere, level design, hidden secrets, and the One Bullet achievement which was actually a lot of fun to do and get done. 9/10.

Half Life 2: Episode 1 is a short and sweet expansion pack of Half Life 2. The game is nothing groundbreaking, being nothing more than five more chapters for Half Life 2. There isn't really anything in particular that the game adds to the Half Life series in terms of gameplay or mechanics, but this doesn't stop it from being fun though, as it offers up a bit more of the enticing world, story, music, and combat from the Half Life Universe. I would recommend this game to anyone who's a fan of Half Life or the genres it is a part of, seeing as it is pretty well priced for such a short game.
One of the best games to ever revolutionize the first person shooter genre, just like Half-life 1, 2 and episode 2. Maybe Half-life Alyx too. I haven't played that one yet.

Although, it is really cool to have Alyx wield a shotgun and a sniper rife like a pro. You do need to play it for Half Life 2 Episode 2 to make sense, so if nothing else, buy it because of that

Tudo de bom do Half-Life 2 continuou aqui

More Half-Life 2 is never bad.

Keeps the same level of quality as the base game, with a bit of a darker, more hurried tone that lends itself to a fantastic rush to escape City 17.

Generally has a lot more puzzles in the first half, but once you leave the Citadel, it's the usual gunplay, which is fun.

I [b]love[/b] some of the chapters in Episode 1, where you're in the complete dark, and for the first time, Gordon no longer feels like a complete powerhouse.

Only flaw I see if that Alyx can do something stupid and die, causing you to reload a past save, even when you have things under control.

If you've played Half-Life 2 and enjoyed it, you'll enjoy Episode 1.
es de valve siempre es bueno
First Playthrough and in the year 2022 it is still a pretty good game.

To say that this is one of the weaker half life games and yet is still amazing shows you how good this series is.
Go play it.

Great continuation of the main game. Definitely worth it. Kinda wish valve would just bundle all the episodes into the main game as DLC or something so that you don't have to install and launch them all separately. Oh well, its still good even if Valve makes weird decisions. Highly recommend.

That... is a 9/10.

The quality never seems to drop with every subsequent addition to the Half-Life series. The thought and love that went into constructing this is clear as day. Alyx reacting to the torch when you shine it on her face is the cherry on the cake for me *chefs kiss*. It's always the minor details.

Episode One is definitely a whole lot of fun, not too long and the music blasting in your ears is always perfectly cued and adds to the atmosphere of what you're doing.
